I am a 2nd year PhD student in the Department of Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins University. I received my bachelorâ€™s in math and statistics from the University of Chicago in 2016.

Currently, I am working on developing statistical methods for cancer etiology and risk estimation as a research assistant for Cristian Tomasetti.

In my free time, I blog about a range of technical (and non-technical) topics related to statistics, computing, and PhD life. I also read fairly regularly, write fiction on occasion, and play violin in the Hopkins Concert Orchestra and the chamber music ensemble Bloombachs.
